channel.title: Posts on Walker Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Walker Lab

item.title: Vishaka's 2nd year defense
item.description: Congratulations to Vishaka for passing her second year defense and officially becoming a PhD candidate! She is the very first student in the lab to reach this important milestone, with more to come.
item.content: Congratulations to Vishaka for passing her second year defense and officially becoming a PhD candidate! She is the very first student in the lab to reach this important milestone, with more to come.

item.title: Wayne State Award Ceremonies
item.description: The Walker lab won a number of awards this year–congratulations to: Anita, for an excellence in teaching award! Solomon, for an excellence in teaching award! Morgan, for the David and Beverly Rorabacher Research Award, which includes a stipend for summer undergraduate research.
item.content:
The Walker lab won a number of awards this year–congratulations to:

Anita, for an excellence in teaching award!

Solomon, for an excellence in teaching award!

Morgan, for the David and Beverly Rorabacher Research Award, which includes a stipend for summer undergraduate research.

item.title: Undergraduate Research Symposium
item.description: Congratulations to Morgan on his first undergraduate research symposium at Wayne State, where he presented a poster and made a fantastic video to promote his work: https://clas.wayne.edu/ugr/symposium/comprehensive-extraction-chemical-data Morgan won a poster award (and a t-shirt).
item.content:
Congratulations to Morgan on his first undergraduate research symposium at Wayne State, where he presented a poster and made a fantastic video to promote his work:

https://clas.wayne.edu/ugr/symposium/comprehensive-extraction-chemical-data

Morgan won a poster award (and a t-shirt).

item.title: ACS 2023
item.description: The Walker group attended the Spring ACS at Indianapolis in style–Vishaka presented her first talk at a national conference about her work on sulfate-sensitive fluorescent proteins. Alice presented a talk at the COMP Undergraduate Symposium.
item.content:
The Walker group attended the Spring ACS at Indianapolis in style–Vishaka presented her first talk at a national conference about her work on sulfate-sensitive fluorescent proteins.

Alice presented a talk at the COMP Undergraduate Symposium.

item.title: New group members
item.description: We had a group lunch to welcome two new students to the lab–Victoria and Anita. Welcome!
item.content: We had a group lunch to welcome two new students to the lab–Victoria and Anita. Welcome!

item.title: Fun with Blender
item.description: Mark’s been working on making accurate Blender-ified orbital animations–next stop, glowing excited state orbitals with accurate dynamics and oscillator strengths!
item.content: Mark’s been working on making accurate Blender-ified orbital animations–next stop, glowing excited state orbitals with accurate dynamics and oscillator strengths!

item.title: Cider Mill
item.description: Michigan has lots of local cider mills–we enjoyed some fall foliage, hot cider and doughnuts just in time for Halloween.
item.content: Michigan has lots of local cider mills–we enjoyed some fall foliage, hot cider and doughnuts just in time for Halloween.

item.title: WSU Graduate Research Symposium 2022
item.description: Solomon was awarded a talk presentation at this year’s Graduate Research Symposium at Wayne State, and did a fantastic job presenting his newly published work on perylene.
item.content: Solomon was awarded a talk presentation at this year’s Graduate Research Symposium at Wayne State, and did a fantastic job presenting his newly published work on perylene.

item.title: Trip to DIA
item.description: Group outing to the Detroit Institute of Art, enjoying the beautiful works inside and out.
item.content: Group outing to the Detroit Institute of Art, enjoying the beautiful works inside and out.

item.title: Group Lunch September 2022
item.description: We went out to celebrate Nina’s birthday and enjoy some local scenery.
item.content: We went out to celebrate Nina’s birthday and enjoy some local scenery.

item.title: ACS Fall 2022
item.description: The Walker lab was well represented this year at Fall ACS. Kaushalya presented her work on the excited state dynamics of benzo[a]pyrene as a poster in the Comp session, and Alice presented the lab research as an invited talk for the Schlegel symposium.
item.content: The Walker lab was well represented this year at Fall ACS. Kaushalya presented her work on the excited state dynamics of benzo[a]pyrene as a poster in the Comp session, and Alice presented the lab research as an invited talk for the Schlegel symposium.

item.title: ACTC 2022 in Lake Tahoe!
item.description: The Walker Group presented two posters at the American Conference on Theoretical Chemistry 2022! Dr. Walker served as the session chair for the Thursday Morning talks, and Mark gave a short presentation during the TeraChem Developers Conference on Friday.
item.content:
The Walker Group presented two posters at the American Conference on Theoretical Chemistry 2022!
Dr. Walker served as the session chair for the Thursday Morning talks, and Mark gave a short presentation during the TeraChem Developers Conference on Friday.

item.title: Fun with neural network image processing
item.description: As a quick break in our summer coding workshop, Vishaka made some lovely artwork with the neural style package in torch!
item.content: As a quick break in our summer coding workshop, Vishaka made some lovely artwork with the neural style package in torch!

item.title: Cover article!
item.description: An article from my postdoctoral research was recently featured as a supplemental cover to J. Phys Chem B! Check it out here!
item.content:
An article from my postdoctoral research was recently featured as a supplemental cover to J. Phys Chem B!

Check it out here!

item.title: 3D proteins in real life!
item.description: If you have a mobile phone, you can play with some WalkerLab proteins in real life, courtesy of Sukolsak Sakshuwong and Umberto Raucci. Go here and type the molecule name of your choice! Alternatively, the following QR codes will display specific proteins relevant to our proposed research. Open up your mobile phone camera app and hover it over the following images; it will ask if you would like to follow a link to display the image interactively on your phone.
item.content:
If you have a mobile phone, you can play with some WalkerLab proteins in real life, courtesy of Sukolsak Sakshuwong and Umberto Raucci.

Go here and type the molecule name of your choice! Alternatively, the following QR codes will display specific proteins relevant to our proposed research. Open up your mobile phone camera app and hover it over the following images; it will ask if you would like to follow a link to display the image interactively on your phone. You can move it around and see it on your desk!

Note that Google Pixel phone support for augmented reality is somewhat questionable. The AR is the most well integrated with iPhones.

Interleukin6 aptamer:



Reversible GFP:



RNA Polymerase II:

item.title: Let's go WalkerLab
item.description: Coming soon to a university near you, if you live in the Detroit area. :)
item.content: Coming soon to a university near you, if you live in the Detroit area. :)

item.title: ACS Spring 2022
item.description: Ashlyn Murphy did an amazing job presenting her undergraduate research at ACS San Diego this month. First conference presentation from the lab!
item.content: Ashlyn Murphy did an amazing job presenting her undergraduate research at ACS San Diego this month. First conference presentation from the lab!
